did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Domenico Facci letters and sketch photographs for Homage to Israel medals
did.abstract: Photographs and letters relating to sculptor Domenico Facci's Homage to Israel medals which were based on Salvador Dalí’s sketches.
did.physloc: Rare Book Room - Pamphlet File DOM-FREE

daodesc.p: One of twelve medals sculpted by Domenico Facci in commemoration of the 25th anniversary of Israel, 1973

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Thirty-one 8x10 photographs of 13 sketches produced by Salvador Dali as designs for Homage to Israel medals commemorating the 25th anniversary of the State of Israel in 1973. The photographs were used by sculptor Domenico Facci to produce the bas reliefs for the medals. Also includes three letters and a bill pertaining to Facci’s work and a promotional booklet.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Domenico Facci was a sculptor, medalist, and painter as well as a teacher at Roerich Academy of Art in New York City. He was born in Hooversville, Pennsylvania, in 1916 and died in 1994.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The materials were presumably given by Domenico Facci to Deborah Friedman, friend and neighbor of the sculptor.
